law.catch_line: Office for Faith-Based and Community Nonprofit Social Services established -- Mission -- Principles -- Duties.

text.section: The Office for Faith-Based and Community Nonprofit Social Services is established in the Office of the Governor. The office shall be administered by a staff person designated by the Governor and shall have sufficient staff as required to implement the provisions of KRS 12.500 to 12.520.

The office shall have primary responsibility to establish policies, priorities, and practices in the executive branch to enable and expand social service programs of faith-based and community nonprofit organizations to the extent permitted by law.

law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 137, sec. 3, effective June 20, 2005.
